alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Lower St. Martin (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 07 at 2:36AM CST until January 09 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. Rainfall totals of 2 to 4 inches are expected, with localized totals of up to 6 inches possible. * WHERE...A portion of south central Louisiana, including the following parishes, Lafayette, Lower Iberia, Lower St. Martin, Lower St. Mary, Upper Iberia, Upper St. Martin and Upper St. Mary. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A strong storm system will move through the area on Monday, accompanied by widespread showers and storms. Some storms will contain heavy rainfall, with storm mergers and training yielding an increased risk for flooding across the area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
